distribution.text: Copyright Â© 2023 Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for kernel is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.6 Extended Update Support.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The kernel packages contain the Linux kernel, the core of any Linux operating system.

Security Fix(es):

* kernel: SCSI target (LIO) write to any block on ILO backstore (CVE-2020-28374)

* kernel: out-of-bounds read in libiscsi module (CVE-2021-27364)

* kernel: heap buffer overflow in the iSCSI subsystem (CVE-2021-27365)

* kernel: use-after-free in fs/block_dev.c (CVE-2020-15436)

* kernel: iscsi: unrestricted access to sessions and handles (CVE-2021-27363)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Bug Fix(es):

* [infiniband] Backport Request to fix Multicast Sendonly joins (BZ#1937820)
notes.title: Details

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: kernel security and bug fix update

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A use-after-free flaw was observed in blkdev_get(), in fs/block_dev.c after a call to __blkdev_get() fails, and its refcount gets freed/released. This problem may cause a denial of service problem with a special user privilege, and may even lead to a confidentiality issue.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

references.summary: bz#1901168: CVE-2020-15436 kernel: use-after-free in fs/block_dev.c

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Linux kernelâs implementation of the Linux SCSI target host, where an authenticated attacker could write to any block on the exported SCSI device backing store. This flaw allows an authenticated attacker to send LIO block requests to the Linux system to overwrite data on the backing store. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity. In addition, this flaw affects the tcmu-runner package, where the affected SCSI command is called.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: SCSI target (LIO) write to any block on ILO backstore
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#1899804: CVE-2020-28374 kernel: SCSI target (LIO) write to any block on ILO backstore

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2020-28374 kernel: SCSI target (LIO) write to any block on ILO backstore

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in the way access to sessions and handles was handled in the iSCSI driver in the Linux kernel. A local user could use this flaw to leak iSCSI transport handle kernel address or end arbitrary iSCSI connections on the system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: iscsi: unrestricted access to sessions and handles
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#1930079: CVE-2021-27363 kernel: iscsi: unrestricted access to sessions and handles

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-27363 kernel: iscsi: unrestricted access to sessions and handles

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. An out-of-bounds read was discovered in the libiscsi module that could lead to reading kernel memory or a crash. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: out-of-bounds read in libiscsi module
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#1930080: CVE-2021-27364 kernel: out-of-bounds read in libiscsi module

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-27364 kernel: out-of-bounds read in libiscsi module

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. A heap buffer overflow in the iSCSI subsystem is triggered by setting an iSCSI string attribute to a value larger than one page and then trying to read it. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: heap buffer overflow in the iSCSI subsystem
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#1930078: CVE-2021-27365 kernel: heap buffer overflow in the iSCSI subsystem

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-27365 kernel: heap buffer overflow in the iSCSI subsystem
